hints.label: def-cst-review
hints.title: Causal Spacetime Tree (CST)
hints.content:
36: :label: def-cst-review
37: 
38: From {doc}`01_fractal_set.md`, the **CST** is a directed acyclic graph $\mathcal{G}_{\text{CST}} = (\mathcal{N}, E_{\text{CST}})$ where:
39: 
40: - **Nodes**: Episodes $\mathcal{N} = \{e_i\}$ with positions $x_i = \Phi(e_i) \in \mathcal{X}$ and time labels $t_i$
41: - **Edges**: $(e_i, e_j) \in E_{\text{CST}}$ if $e_j$ is a direct descendant of $e_i$ (via survival or cloning)
42: - **Partial order**: $e_i \prec e_j$ if there exists a directed path from $e_i$ to $e_j$
43: 
44: **Causal structure**: The CST satisfies causal set axioms ({prf:ref}`prop-cst-causal-set-structure` from {doc}`04_rigorous_additions.md`):
45: - Reflexive: $e \prec e$
hints.raw_directive:
33: ### 1.1. Fractal Set and CST Review
34: 
35: :::{prf:definition} Causal Spacetime Tree (CST)
36: :label: def-cst-review
37: 
38: From {doc}`01_fractal_set.md`, the **CST** is a directed acyclic graph $\mathcal{G}_{\text{CST}} = (\mathcal{N}, E_{\text{CST}})$ where:
39: 
40: - **Nodes**: Episodes $\mathcal{N} = \{e_i\}$ with positions $x_i = \Phi(e_i) \in \mathcal{X}$ and time labels $t_i$
41: - **Edges**: $(e_i, e_j) \in E_{\text{CST}}$ if $e_j$ is a direct descendant of $e_i$ (via survival or cloning)
42: - **Partial order**: $e_i \prec e_j$ if there exists a directed path from $e_i$ to $e_j$
43: 
44: **Causal structure**: The CST satisfies causal set axioms ({prf:ref}`prop-cst-causal-set-structure` from {doc}`04_rigorous_additions.md`):
45: - Reflexive: $e \prec e$
46: - Antisymmetric: $e_i \prec e_j$ and $e_j \prec e_i \Rightarrow i = j$

hints.label: def-separating-antichain
hints.title: Separating Antichain
hints.content:
51: :label: def-separating-antichain
52: 
53: For a spatial region $A \subset \mathcal{X}$, a **separating antichain** $\gamma_A$ is a subset of episodes $\gamma_A \subset \mathcal{N}$ such that:
54: 
55: 1. **Antichain property**: No two episodes in $\gamma_A$ are causally related ($e_i, e_j \in \gamma_A \Rightarrow e_i \not\prec e_j$)
56: 2. **Separating property**: Every causal chain starting in $A$ (episodes with $x_i \in A$) and ending outside $A$ must pass through $\gamma_A$
57: 
58: **Minimal antichain**: $\gamma_A$ is **minimal** if $|\gamma_A|$ is minimized among all separating antichains.

hints.label: def-voronoi-at-time
hints.title: Voronoi Tessellation at Fixed Time
hints.content:
66: :label: def-voronoi-at-time
67: 
68: From {prf:ref}`def-riemannian-voronoi` in {doc}`../14_scutoid_geometry_framework.md`:
69: 
70: For a swarm state at time $t$ with alive set $\mathcal{A}(t) = \{i : e_i \text{ alive at } t\}$, the **Riemannian Voronoi cell** of walker $i$ is:
71: 
72: $$
73: \text{Vor}_i(t) = \left\{ x \in \mathcal{X} : d_g(x, x_i(t)) \le d_g(x, x_j(t)) \, \forall j \in \mathcal{A}(t) \right\}
74: $$
75: 
76: where $d_g$ is the geodesic distance in the emergent Riemannian manifold $(\mathcal{X}, g(\cdot, t))$.
77: 
78: **Tessellation**: $\mathcal{V}_t = \{\text{Vor}_i(t) : i \in \mathcal{A}(t)\}$ partitions the valid domain:
79: 
80: $$

63: ### 1.2. Scutoid Tessellation and Voronoi Cells
64: 
65: :::{prf:definition} Voronoi Tessellation at Fixed Time
66: :label: def-voronoi-at-time
67: 
68: From {prf:ref}`def-riemannian-voronoi` in {doc}`../14_scutoid_geometry_framework.md`:
69: 
70: For a swarm state at time $t$ with alive set $\mathcal{A}(t) = \{i : e_i \text{ alive at } t\}$, the **Riemannian Voronoi cell** of walker $i$ is:
71: 
72: $$
73: \text{Vor}_i(t) = \left\{ x \in \mathcal{X} : d_g(x, x_i(t)) \le d_g(x, x_j(t)) \, \forall j \in \mathcal{A}(t) \right\}
74: $$
75: 
76: where $d_g$ is the geodesic distance in the emergent Riemannian manifold $(\mathcal{X}, g(\cdot, t))$.
77: 
78: **Tessellation**: $\mathcal{V}_t = \{\text{Vor}_i(t) : i \in \mathcal{A}(t)\}$ partitions the valid domain:
79: 
80: $$
81: \bigcup_{i \in \mathcal{A}(t)} \text{Vor}_i(t) = \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}

89: 
90: At QSD, episodes are distributed in space with density:
91: 
92: $$
93: \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) = \int_{\mathbb{R}^d} \pi_{\text{QSD}}(x, v) \, dv \propto \sqrt{\det g(x)} \, \exp\left( -\frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T} \right)
94: $$
95: 
96: **Critical property**: The factor $\sqrt{\det g(x)}$ means episodes sample from the **Riemannian volume measure**.
97: 
98: **Normalization**: For the proof, we normalize so that:
99: 
100: $$
101: \int_{\mathcal{X}} \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) \, dx = 1
102: $$
103:

105: 
106: $$
